I'd highly recommend you watch "Taxi Driver." This classic film tells a gripping story about a troubled taxi driver who becomes entangled in the underworld of New York City, brilliantly portrayed by Robert De Niro. It's an intense and thought-provoking movie that combines action with deep psychological drama. If you enjoy character-driven stories and powerful performances, I believe you'll appreciate "Taxi Driver."

Another film you might find interesting is "The Violent Kind." Set in the Northern California woods, this horror thriller follows a group of bikers who are tormented by possessed girls and 50s-style rockabillies. With its unique plot and intriguing cast, it's sure to keep you on the edge of your seat.

Alternatively, 'The Reflecting Skin' might also interest you. This film explores a young boy's dark fantasies about a widow living nearby, played by Lindsay Duncan and Viggo Mortensen. It's a captivating story set in rural USA during the 1950s."

I'd highly recommend watching "The Time Traveler's Wife". It's a captivating story about a man with a unique genetic disorder that causes him to involuntarily time travel, and his struggles as he navigates life alongside his wife who finds it difficult to cope with this extraordinary situation. Starring Eric Bana and Rachel McAdams, it's a moving exploration of love and the challenges it can face when intertwined with time itself.

If you fancy something more action-packed, "The Wraith" could be right up your alley. It tells the story of a mysterious stranger who arrives in a small town and targets a violent motorcycle gang. With Randy Quaid in two roles, this movie offers a thrilling blend of drama, mystery, and suspense.
